macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Mixed in Friday Close
items.summary: The S&P 500 edged up slightly to 6915.61 (+0.03%), Nasdaq rose 0.3% to 23,501.24, while Dow Jones fell 285 points (-0.6%) to 49,098.71 amid mixed trading and sector weakness in financials and health care.[1][2][3][5]
items.source: Trading Economics, LA Times, Marietta Times

items.title: Intel Tumbles as Wall Street Drifts Lower
items.summary: Intel shares tumbled significantly, contributing to a cautious market tone, while gold prices hit another record high amid mixed trading on Friday.[2][3]

items.title: Clorox Acquires GOJO Industries for $2.25 Billion
items.summary: Clorox announced the purchase of Purell maker GOJO Industries for $2.25 billion in cash, with shares gaining 1.1-1.7% on the news.[2][3]

items.title: CSX Shares Climb Despite Weaker Earnings
items.summary: Railroad CSX rose 2.4-4.2% after reporting weaker-than-expected profits, buoyed by positive 2026 operating profit retention forecast per revenue dollar.[2][3]

items.title: Treasury Yields Dip Amid Positive Consumer Data
items.summary: 10-year Treasury yield fell to 4.23-4.25% as bond prices rose; consumer sentiment improved, inflation expectations eased to 4%, and S&P Global reported ongoing business growth.[2][3]

items.title: Broad Equity Weakness with VIX Surge
items.summary: All seven major equity indices posted losses on January 23, with VIX surging 9.47%, signaling risk-off sentiment and rising volatility.[4]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: BitGo Debuts on NYSE, Signaling Institutional Appetite for Crypto Infrastructure
items.summary: Crypto custody firm BitGo went public this week, opening above its IPO price with a multi-billion-dollar valuation. The listing is being watched as a bellwether for other crypto companies considering public markets amid evolving regulatory conditions.

items.title: Strategy Adds $2.13B in Bitcoin Despite Market Volatility
items.summary: Michael Saylor's bitcoin-focused firm Strategy purchased approximately 22,305 BTC worth $2.13 billion over an eight-day span, demonstrating continued institutional accumulation even as broader market sentiment has cooled.

items.title: Crypto Markets Slide on Tariff Rhetoric, Major Assets Down Double Digits
items.summary: Cryptocurrency markets experienced sharp pullbacks this week driven by renewed tariff and trade policy discussions. Ethereum fell 9.7% and Solana dropped 10.9% over seven days, with broader synchronized selloffs across majors and altcoins.

items.title: Binance Founder CZ Predicts Bitcoin Super Cycle in 2026
items.summary: Changpeng Zhao forecasts Bitcoin may break its traditional four-year cycle in 2026 due to supportive U.S. crypto regulations and global adoption, with experts predicting BTC could surge past $300K in a liquidity-driven market wave.

items.title: Senate Agriculture Committee to Mark Up Crypto Market Structure Bill on January 27
items.summary: The Senate Agriculture Committee will advance crypto market structure legislation on January 27, with Trump administration officials expressing commitment to signing a crypto bill soon to establish America as the crypto capital.

items.title: Senate Republicans Release New Crypto Market Structure Draft
items.summary: Senate Agriculture Committee Chair John Boozman released a new draft crypto market structure bill on Wednesday with Republican backing, continuing active discussions on Capitol Hill despite the Senate recess.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Innovations Transforming Software Development in 2026
items.summary: The tech industry is experiencing a surge of advancements in AI-driven software development, including new tools for real-time monitoring of AI workflows and testing frameworks that can identify compatibility issues across 600,000+ devices. Yann LeCun's departure from Meta to found AMI Labs, focusing on 'world model' AI, is also capturing industry attention.

items.title: Agentic AI Becomes 2026's Operating System for Enterprise
items.summary: Gartner predicts that 40% of enterprise applications will embed purpose-built AI agents by 2026, with adoption growth rates exceeding 280%. The focus has shifted from what's possible to what's executable at scale, with agentic AI now taking autonomous action in real-time across defense, energy, logistics, and cyber sectors.

items.title: AI Demand Drives $600B GPU and Data Center Expansion
items.summary: The global data center GPU market is experiencing rapid growth due to AI demand, with the market estimated at $14.48 billion in 2024. Data center electricity consumption surged 73% from 2023 to 2024, reaching 415 TWh globally, driving increased investment in nuclear power to support AI infrastructure.

items.title: Diffusion Language Models Achieve Breakthrough in Black-Box Optimization
items.summary: Researchers have developed a novel diffusion large language model (dLLM) technique that achieves state-of-the-art results in offline black-box optimization, with applications ranging from DNA sequence design to robotic control strategies without requiring costly online evaluations.

items.title: GEP Recognized as Leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for AI-Powered Procurement
items.summary: GEP has been placed in the Leaders Quadrant of the 2026 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Source-to-Pay Suites, recognized for its agentic AI platform designed to automate procurement and supply chain workflows at enterprise scale.

items.title: PropellerAds Advances AI-Driven Fraud Detection in Digital Advertising
items.summary: PropellerAds has invested in machine-learning models trained on global traffic patterns to detect and block fraudulent ads in near real-time, automatically scoring traffic quality and assessing creatives for malware risks before campaigns launch.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: GTA 6 Development Budget Reportedly Exceeds $1 Billion
items.summary: Reports indicate that Grand Theft Auto 6's budget has surpassed $1 billion, potentially setting records for AAA games, with an expected price of $80-$100 and a confirmed release date of November 19, 2026. The game promises a massive open world, improved AI, and enhanced online features, influencing industry release schedules.

items.title: Speedrobo Games Releases New Video Update on January 24
items.summary: Indie developer Speedrobo Games posted a new news video today covering their portfolio of games including Card Battle Spirit Link, Crash Cribbage, and others, alongside services like game development and marketing.

items.title: Community Discussion on Fable: The Rings of Power Heats Up
items.summary: Forum users on RPGHQ debate the latest on Fable: The Rings of Power, with one post today comparing its style to games like The Sims and Hogwarts Legacy, suggesting a lighter, more accessible tone.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Sony and TCL Form Joint Venture for TV Manufacturing
items.summary: Sony announced a joint venture with TCL where TCL holds 51% ownership to manufacture Sony TVs, marking a significant shift in display development and production likely influenced by Chinese ownership rules.

items.title: Capital One to Acquire Brex in $5.15 Billion Deal
items.summary: Capital One announced a landmark $5.15 billion acquisition of fintech firm Brex, expanding its offerings in business financial services.

items.title: Airwallex Acquires Paynuri to Enter South Korean Market
items.summary: Fintech company Airwallex acquired Paynuri to expand into South Korea, strengthening its global payments infrastructure.

items.title: JP Morgan Acquires WealthOS for Pensions Boost
items.summary: JP Morgan acquired WealthOS to enhance its pensions and wealth management offerings amid growing demand in fintech services.

items.title: Anduril Commits $1 Billion to New California Campus
items.summary: Defense tech startup Anduril plans a $1 billion investment in a new Long Beach campus for advanced systems development, signaling growth in defense hardware.

items.title: Micron Sells Out Entire 2026 HBM Supply
items.summary: Micron Technology reported its full 2026 inventory of high-bandwidth memory chips sold out before year-end 2025, with plans for major U.S. manufacturing expansion.

items.title: Spotify Launches Prompted Playlists in US and Canada
items.summary: Spotify rolled out its Prompted Playlists feature to the US and Canada, allowing users to guide algorithm-driven playlist creation beyond basic prompts.
